decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with Dredge cards like Golgari Thug and Stinkweed Imp to bring back powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Narcomoeba. Using Bazaar of Baghdad and cards like Grief and Serum Powder to efficiently filter through the deck and find combo pieces. The deck looks to win by overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of creatures and using cards like Creeping Chill and Silversmote Ghoul to gain life and keep the pressure on. Force of Will and Force of Negation provide protection against disruption from the opponent.

The deck is focused on utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to draw cards and generate mana to quickly assemble a powerful combo. It includes a mix of fast mana cards like Black Lotus and Moxen, along with disruptive spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. The goal is to generate a large amount of mana, draw through the deck, and either win through a powerful finisher like Thundertrap Trainer or set up a lock with cards like Soul-Guide Lantern and Stock Up.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the combo pieces needed to set up a game-winning Doomsday situation. The deck includes various card draw and manipulation spells like Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm to find the necessary cards quickly. It also includes protection spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to defend against disruption from the opponent. The combo involves casting Doomsday to set up a winning pile of cards, often including Thassa's Oracle, to win the game on the spot. Lurrus of the Dream-Den can provide additional value by bringing back key permanents from the graveyard.

The deck focuses on using artifacts to generate mana and disrupt the opponent's resources while deploying aggressive threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Scrawling Crawler. The deck seeks to control the game with cards like Trinisphere, Null Rod, and Sphere of Resistance, making it difficult for the opponent to cast spells efficiently. With a combination of artifact acceleration and disruptive elements, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and lock them out of the game.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and consistently fill the graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, then utilize cards like Narcomoeba and Ichorid to bring back powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Hollow One. This deck aims to generate advantage by recurring creatures from the graveyard and overwhelming the opponent with a combination of fast, explosive plays and disruptive elements like Force of Will and Force of Negation. Bazaar of Baghdad helps to filter through the deck and set up graveyard interactions, making this deck a potent threat in Vintage 1 vs 1.

The deck focuses on exploiting artifact synergy and disrupting the opponent's game plan through cards like Trinisphere, Nettlecyst, and Null Rod. It aims to quickly establish a board presence with aggressive creatures like Scrawling Crawler and Patchwork Automaton while using mana acceleration from cards like Mishra's Workshop and Sol Ring. The inclusion of powerful artifacts like Black Lotus, Mana Crypt, and Moxen helps to ramp up quickly and play threats ahead of schedule. The deck also has access to disruptive cards like Sphere of Resistance, Thorn of Amethyst, and Chalice of the Void to slow down the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy utilizing cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Dreadhorde Arcanist to apply pressure early on. It also has a strong control aspect with counterspells like Force of Will and disruptive spells like Prismatic Ending. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for card advantage and recurring threats. The deck aims to outmaneuver opponents with efficient plays and card advantage, providing both aggressive and defensive options to secure victory in a Vintage 1 vs 1 setting.

This deck focuses on creating a powerful combo using Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and mana efficiency. By utilizing a combination of mana-producing artifacts and cantrips, the deck aims to chain together multiple spells in a single turn to overwhelm the opponent. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a versatile companion option, providing additional value and recursion for important cards. The deck also includes key disruptive elements such as Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to control the game and protect the combo.

The main premise of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures such as Prized Amalgam, Narcomoeba, and Stinkweed Imp to easily bring them back to the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent. Using cards like Golgari Thug and Shambling Shell to dredge through the deck, this combo deck aims to set up powerful plays that can be protected by counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Creeping Chill and Silversmote Ghoul to chip away at the opponent's life total while maintaining a strong board presence. The use of Bazaar of Baghdad allows for efficient graveyard filling and card selection, making this deck a formidable force in Vintage 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with Dredge creatures and then use them to bring back powerful creatures such as Prized Amalgam and Hollow One for explosive combos. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug to dredge through the deck quickly, while also utilizing cards like Noxious Revival and Force of Will to protect its key combo pieces. Additionally, cards like Creeping Chill provide extra reach and damage potential, while Shambling Shell and Grief offer additional graveyard synergy and disruption options.

The deck revolves around assembling the perfect combination of cards to win the game in a single turn using the Doomsday combo. The key strategy involves utilizing various card draw spells and interaction to set up a winning pile of cards to play Thassa's Oracle and win the game on the spot. Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds resilience and flexibility to the deck, allowing for additional value and recursion of key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to carefully plan and execute a game-winning sequence of plays to achieve victory.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while aggressively applying pressure with efficient creatures. By utilizing hatebears like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex, it slows down the opponent's spells and taxing their resources. Cavern of Souls ensures that threats like White Plume Adventurer and Clarion Conqueror resolve without interference. The deck also includes disruptive artifacts like Void Mirror to further disrupt the opponent's plays. With a mix of disruption and aggression, this deck aims to control the game and secure victory through overwhelming pressure.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disruption and card advantage, utilizing a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells to control the game. It also includes powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise to stay ahead in card advantage. With efficient threats like Psychic Frog and Orcish Bowmasters, as well as disruption like Null Rod and Soul-Guide Lantern, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while developing its own board presence. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and recursion options.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using Oath of Druids in combination with Atraxa, Grand Unifier and other powerful creatures to quickly dominate the board. The deck includes various counterspells and disruptive cards to protect its key pieces, as well as tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor to find the necessary combo pieces. Show and Tell and Flash are included to cheat out big threats early in the game. Overall, the strategy revolves around quickly establishing board presence and controlling the game until victory is achieved.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's plays with cards like Chalice of the Void, Sphere of Resistance, and Trinisphere while also ramping up with fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Mana Crypt. It aims to lock down the opponent's resources with Null Rod and Strip Mine while deploying threats like Lodestone Golem and Stonecoil Serpent to pressure the opponent's life total. Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Mystic Forge provide card advantage and utility, while Karn, the Great Creator can fetch important artifacts from the sideboard to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Phyrexian Dreadnought combo to quickly bring out a big threat while also disrupting the opponent's game plan. By combining cards like Strict Proctor, Suppression Field, and Force of Will, the deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from stopping the combo. With the card advantage provided by Ancestral Recall and the tutoring ability of Merchant Scroll, the deck can find the pieces it needs to win. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional resilience and recursion to the deck's strategy.
